document.title: The National Standards for Arts Education

9BD49370DFE601313E8B68A86D17958E.description: Students identify connections between the visual arts and other disciplines in the curriculum

9BD44740DFE601313E8A68A86D17958E.description: Students understand and use similarities and differences between characteristics of the visual arts and other arts disciplines

9BD3A490DFE601313E8868A86D17958E.description: Making connections between visual arts and other disciplines

9BD34840DFE601313E8768A86D17958E.description: Students understand there are different responses to specific artworks

9BD2FDF0DFE601313E8668A86D17958E.description: Students describe how people's experiences influence the development of specific artworks

9BD2B290DFE601313E8568A86D17958E.description: Students understand there are various purposes for creating works of visual art

9BD21670DFE601313E8368A86D17958E.description: Reflecting upon and assessing the characteristics and merits of their work and the work of others

9BD1BCB0DFE601313E8268A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate how history, culture, and the visual arts can influence each other in making and studying works of art

9BD15770DFE601313E8168A86D17958E.description: Students identify specific works of art as belonging to particular cultures, times, and places

9BD105F0DFE601313E8068A86D17958E.description: Students know that the visual arts have both a history and specific relationships to various cultures

9BD05240DFE601313E7E68A86D17958E.description: Understanding the visual arts in relation to history and cultures

9BCFF930DFE601313E7D68A86D17958E.description: Students select and use subject matter, symbols, and ideas to communicate meaning

9BCFABF0DFE601313E7C68A86D17958E.description: Students explore and understand prospective content for works of art

9BCF0540DFE601313E7A68A86D17958E.description: Choosing and evaluating a range of subject matter, symbols, and ideas

9BCEA6E0DFE601313E7968A86D17958E.description: Students use visual structures and functions of art to communicate ideas

9BCE43D0DFE601313E7868A86D17958E.description: Students describe how different expressive features and organizational principles cause different responses

9BCDDB90DFE601313E7768A86D17958E.description: Students know the differences among visual characteristics and purposes of art in order to convey ideas

9BCD3CA0DFE601313E7568A86D17958E.description: Using knowledge of structures and functions

9BCCF3A0DFE601313E7468A86D17958E.description: Students use art materials and tools in a safe and responsible manner

9BCCA8D0DFE601313E7368A86D17958E.description: Students use different media, techniques, and processes to communicate ideas, experiences, and stories

9BCC5F40DFE601313E7268A86D17958E.description: Students describe how different materials, techniques, and processes cause different responses

9BCC09D0DFE601313E7168A86D17958E.description: Students know the differences between materials, techniques, and processes

9BCB4E30DFE601313E6F68A86D17958E.description: Understanding and applying media, techniques, and processes

9BCAAD90DFE601313E6D68A86D17958E.description: Students identify and compare the various settings and reasons for creating dramas and attending theatre, film, television, and electronic media productions

9BCA52B0DFE601313E6C68A86D17958E.description: Students identify and compare similar characters and situations in stories and dramas from and about various cultures, illustrate with classroom dramatizations, and discuss how theatre reflects life

9BC9A740DFE601313E6A68A86D17958E.description: Understanding context by recognizing the role of theatre, film, television, and electronic media in daily life

9BC95B00DFE601313E6968A86D17958E.description: Students analyze classroom dramatizations and, using appropriate terminology, constructively suggest alternative ideas for dramatizing roles, arranging environments, and developing situations along with means of improving the collaborative processes of planning, playing, responding, and evaluating

9BC90D70DFE601313E6868A86D17958E.description: Students articulate emotional responses to and explain personal preferences about the whole as well as the parts of dramatic performances

9BC8B3D0DFE601313E6768A86D17958E.description: Students explain how the wants and needs of characters are similar to and different from their own

9BC85100DFE601313E6668A86D17958E.description: Students identify and describe the visual, aural, oral, and kinetic elements of classroom dramatizations and dramatic performances

9BC7C350DFE601313E6468A86D17958E.description: Analyzing and explaining personal preferences and constructing meanings from classroom dramatizations and from theatre, film, television, and electronic media productions

9BC77EB0DFE601313E6368A86D17958E.description: Students select movement, music, or visual elements to enhance the mood of a classroom dramatization

9BC73550DFE601313E6268A86D17958E.description: Students compare how ideas and emotions are expressed in theatre, dramatic media, dance, music, and visual arts

9BC6E630DFE601313E6168A86D17958E.description: Students describe visual, aural, oral, and kinetic elements in theatre, dramatic media, dance, music, and visual arts

9BC64D20DFE601313E5F68A86D17958E.description: Comparing and connecting art forms by describing theatre, dramatic media (such as film, television, and electronic media), and other art forms

9BC604C0DFE601313E5E68A86D17958E.description: Students communicate information to peers about people, events, time, and place related to classroom dramatizations

9BC56F00DFE601313E5C68A86D17958E.description: Researching by finding information to support classroom dramatizations

9BC51C30DFE601313E5B68A86D17958E.description: Students collaboratively plan and prepare improvisations and demonstrate various ways of staging classroom dramatizations

9BC41B90DFE601313E5868A86D17958E.description: Students collaborate to establish playing spaces for classroom dramatizations and to select and safely organize available materials that suggest scenery, properties, lighting, sound, costumes, and makeup

9BC3C330DFE601313E5768A86D17958E.description: Students visualize environments and construct designs to communicate locale and mood using visual elements (such as space, color, line, shape, texture) and aural aspects using a variety of sound sources

9BC301D0DFE601313E5568A86D17958E.description: Designing by visualizing and arranging environments for classroom dramatizations

9BC2B2D0DFE601313E5468A86D17958E.description: Students assume roles that exhibit concentration and contribute to the action of classroom dramatizations based on personal experience and heritage, imagination, literature, and history

9BC26790DFE601313E5368A86D17958E.description: Students use variations of locomotor and nonlocomotor movement and vocal pitch, tempo, and tone for different characters

9BC220E0DFE601313E5268A86D17958E.description: Students imagine and clearly describe characters, their relationships, and their environments

9BC18A00DFE601313E5068A86D17958E.description: Acting by assuming roles and interacting in improvisations

9BC134A0DFE601313E4F68A86D17958E.description: Students improvise dialogue to tell stories, and formalize improvisations by writing or recording the dialogue

9BC0EA30DFE601313E4E68A86D17958E.description: Students collaborate to select interrelated characters, environments, and situations for classroom dramatizations

9BC04FA0DFE601313E4C68A86D17958E.description: Script writing by planning and recording improvisations based on personal experience and heritage, imagination, literature, and history

9BBFB690DFE601313E4A68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate audience behavior appropriate for the context and style of music performed

9BBF5E10DFE601313E4968A86D17958E.description: Students identify and describe roles of musicians (e.g., orchestra conductor, folksinger, church organist) in various music settings and cultures

9BBF0CE0DFE601313E4868A86D17958E.description: Students identify various uses of music in their daily experiences and describe characteristics that make certain music suitable for each use

9BBEB890DFE601313E4768A86D17958E.description: Students describe in simple terms how elements of music are used in music examples from various cultures of the world

9BBE5780DFE601313E4668A86D17958E.description: Students identify by genre or style aural examples of music from various historical periods and cultures

9BBDB510DFE601313E4468A86D17958E.description: Understanding music in relation to history and culture

9BBD4450DFE601313E4368A86D17958E.description: Students identify ways in which the principles and subject matter of other disciplines taught in the school are interrelated with those of music (e.g., foreign languages: singing songs in various languages; language arts: using the expressive elements of music in interpretive readings; mathematics: mathematical basis of values of notes, rests, and time signatures; science: vibration of strings, drum heads, or air columns generating sounds used in music; geography: songs associated with various countries or regions)

9BBCE920DFE601313E4268A86D17958E.description: Students identify similarities and differences in the meanings of common terms (e.g., form, line, contrast) used in the various arts

9BBC5970DFE601313E4068A86D17958E.description: Understanding relationships between music, the other arts, and disciplines outside the arts

9BBC0CD0DFE601313E3F68A86D17958E.description: Students explain, using appropriate music terminology, their personal preferences for specific musical works and styles

9BBBBD60DFE601313E3E68A86D17958E.description: Students devise criteria for evaluating performances and compositions

9BBAD410DFE601313E3B68A86D17958E.description: Students respond through purposeful movement (e.g., swaying, skipping, dramatic play) to selected prominent music characteristics or to specific music events (e.g., meter changes, dynamic changes, same/different sections) while listening to music

9BBA7370DFE601313E3A68A86D17958E.description: Students identify the sounds of a variety of instruments, including many orchestra and band instruments, and instruments from various cultures, as well as children's voices and male and female adult voices

9BBA1EF0DFE601313E3968A86D17958E.description: Students use appropriate terminology in explaining music, music notation, music instruments and voices, and music performances

9BB9C5A0DFE601313E3868A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate perceptual skills by moving, by answering questions about, and by describing aural examples of music of various styles representing diverse cultures

9BB96880DFE601313E3768A86D17958E.description: Students identify simple music forms when presented aurally

9BB8C3D0DFE601313E3568A86D17958E.description: Listening to, analyzing, and describing music

9BB86230DFE601313E3468A86D17958E.description: Students use standard symbols to notate meter, rhythm, pitch, and dynamics in simple patterns presented by the teacher

9BB81530DFE601313E3368A86D17958E.description: Students identify symbols and traditional terms referring to dynamics, tempo, and articulation and interpret them correctly when performing

9BB7C340DFE601313E3268A86D17958E.description: Students use a system (that is, syllables, numbers, or letters) to read simple pitch notation in the treble clef in major keys

9BB773D0DFE601313E3168A86D17958E.description: Students read whole, half, dotted half, quarter, and eighth notes and rests in 2/4, 3/4, and 4/4 meter signatures

9BB683E0DFE601313E2E68A86D17958E.description: Students use a variety of sound sources when composing

9BB63B40DFE601313E2D68A86D17958E.description: Students create and arrange short songs and instrumental pieces within specified guidelines (e.g., a particular style, form, instrumentation, compositional technique)

9BB5EF00DFE601313E2C68A86D17958E.description: Students create and arrange music to accompany readings or dramatizations

9BB54D90DFE601313E2A68A86D17958E.description: Composing and arranging music within specified guidelines

9BB4EAC0DFE601313E2968A86D17958E.description: Students improvise short songs and instrumental pieces, using a variety of sound sources, including traditional sounds (e.g., voices, instruments), nontraditional sounds available in the classroom (e.g., paper tearing, pencil tapping), body sounds (e.g., hands clapping, fingers snapping), and sounds produced by electronic means (e.g., personal computers and basic MIDI devices, including keyboards, sequencers, synthesizers, and drum machines)

9BB49010DFE601313E2868A86D17958E.description: Students improvise simple rhythmic variations and simple melodic embellishments on familiar melodies

9BB43270DFE601313E2768A86D17958E.description: Students improvise simple rhythmic and melodic ostinato accompaniments

9BB3D650DFE601313E2668A86D17958E.description: Students improvise "answers" in the same style to given rhythmic and melodic phrases

9BB2D9B0DFE601313E2368A86D17958E.description: Students perform independent instrumental parts (e.g., simple rhythmic or melodic ostinatos, constrasting rhythmic lines, harmonic progressions, and chords) while other students sing or play contrasting parts

9BB28DF0DFE601313E2268A86D17958E.description: Students perform in groups, blending instrumental timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor

9BB23CF0DFE601313E2168A86D17958E.description: Students echo short rhythms and melodic patterns

9BB1CB90DFE601313E2068A86D17958E.description: Students perform expressively a varied repertoire of music representing diverse genres and styles

9BB166E0DFE601313E1F68A86D17958E.description: Students perform easy rhythmic, melodic, and chordal patterns accurately and independently on rhythmic, melodic, and harmonic classroom instruments

9BB11410DFE601313E1E68A86D17958E.description: Students perform on pitch, in rhythm, with appropriate dynamics and timbre, and maintain a steady tempo

9BB08770DFE601313E1C68A86D17958E.description: Performing on instruments, alone and with others, a varied repertoire of music

9BB03FA0DFE601313E1B68A86D17958E.description: Students sing in groups, blending vocal timbres, matching dynamic levels, and responding to the cues of a conductor

9BAFF470DFE601313E1A68A86D17958E.description: Students sing ostinatos, partner songs, and rounds

9BAF95E0DFE601313E1968A86D17958E.description: Students sing from memory a varied repertoire of songs representing genres and styles from diverse cultures

9BAF1EE0DFE601313E1868A86D17958E.description: Students sing expressively, with appropriate dynamics, phrasing, and interpretation

9BAECD00DFE601313E1768A86D17958E.description: Students sing independently, on pitch and in rhythm, with appropriate timbre, diction, and posture, and maintain a steady tempo

9BAE3FF0DFE601313E1568A86D17958E.description: Singing, alone and with others, a varied repertoire of music

9BADAC60DFE601313E1368A86D17958E.description: Students respond to a dance using another art form; explain the connections between the dance and their response to it (such as stating how their paintings reflect the dance they saw)

9BAD5C20DFE601313E1268A86D17958E.description: Students create a dance project that reveals understanding of a concept or idea from another discipline (such as pattern in dance and science)

9BACCAE0DFE601313E1068A86D17958E.description: Making connections between dance and other disciplines

9BAC7430DFE601313E0F68A86D17958E.description: Students explain how healthy practices (such as nutrition, safety) enhance their ability to dance, citing multiple examples

9BAC0880DFE601313E0E68A86D17958E.description: Students identify at least three personal goals to improve themselves as dancers

9BAB6A60DFE601313E0C68A86D17958E.description: Making connections between dance and healthful living

9BAB24F0DFE601313E0B68A86D17958E.description: Students accurately answer questions about dance in a particular culture and time period (for example: In colonial America, why and in what settings did people dance? What did the dances look like?)

9BAADE80DFE601313E0A68A86D17958E.description: Students learn and effectively share a dance from a resource in their own community; describe the cultural and/or historical context

9BAA95C0DFE601313E0968A86D17958E.description: Students perform folk dances from various cultures with competence and confidence

9BA9F210DFE601313E0768A86D17958E.description: Demonstrating and understanding dance in various cultures and historical periods

9BA9A750DFE601313E0668A86D17958E.description: Students observe two dances and discuss how they are similar and different in terms of one of the elements of dance by observing body shapes, levels, pathways

9BA95CE0DFE601313E0568A86D17958E.description: Students explore, discover, and realize multiple solutions to a given movement problem; choose their favorite solution and discuss the reasons for that choice

9BA8C670DFE601313E0368A86D17958E.description: Applying and demonstrating critical and creative thinking skills in dance

9BA86CD0DFE601313E0268A86D17958E.description: Students present their own dances to peers and discuss their meanings with competence and confidence

9BA813A0DFE601313E0168A86D17958E.description: Students take an active role in a class discussion about interpretations of and reactions to a dance

9BA7BFB0DFE601313E0068A86D17958E.description: Students observe and discuss how dance is different from other forms of human movement (such as sports, everyday gestures)

9BA71990DFE601313DFE68A86D17958E.description: Understanding dance as a way to create and communicate meaning

9BA6BEA0DFE601313DFD68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate the following partner skills: copying, leading and following, mirroring

9BA65A30DFE601313DFC68A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate the ability to work effectively alone and with a partner

9BA61510DFE601313DFB68A86D17958E.description: Students create a dance phrase, accurately repeat it, and then vary it (making changes in the time, space, and/or force/energy)

9BA5D000DFE601313DFA68A86D17958E.description: Students use improvisation to discover and invent movement and to solve movement problems

9BA58910DFE601313DF968A86D17958E.description: Students improvise, create, and perform dances based on their own ideas and concepts from other sources

9BA53FA0DFE601313DF868A86D17958E.description: Students create a sequence with a beginning, middle, and end, both with and without a rhythmic accompaniment; identify each of these parts of the sequence

9BA4A020DFE601313DF668A86D17958E.description: Understanding choreographic principles, processes, and structures

9BA455E0DFE601313DF568A86D17958E.description: Students attentively observe and accurately describe the action (such as skip, gallop) and movement elements (such as levels, directions) in a brief movement study

9BA40890DFE601313DF468A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate kinesthetic awareness, concentration, and focus in performing movement skills

9BA3BB80DFE601313DF368A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate accuracy in moving to a musical beat and responding to changes in tempo

9BA372B0DFE601313DF268A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate movements in straight and curved pathways

9BA328C0DFE601313DF168A86D17958E.description: Students demonstrate the ability to define and maintain personal space

9BA2CB30DFE601313DF068A86D17958E.description: Students create shapes at low, middle, and high levels

9BA27CF0DFE601313DEF68A86D17958E.description: Students accurately demonstrate eight basic locomotor movements (such as walk, run, hop, jump, leap, gallop, slide, and skip), traveling forward, backward, sideward, diagonally, and turning

9BA22E70DFE601313DEE68A86D17958E.description: Students accurately demonstrate nonlocomotor/axial movements (such as bend, twist, stretch, swing)

9BA198A0DFE601313DEC68A86D17958E.description: Identifying and demonstrating movement elements and skills in performing dance
